mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.items

Interface IScriptInventory


  • public interface IScriptInventory
    This interface represents an inventory.

    See IScriptPlayer.getInventory() and IScriptWorld.getInventory(int, int, int) for ways to get inventories from player and world, respectively.

    
    function main(c)
    {
        // Get player's inventory
        if (c.getSubject().isPlayer())
        {
            var inventory = c.getSubject().getInventory();

            // Do something with player's inventory
        }

        // Get chest's inventory in the world
        if (c.getWorld().hasInventory(214, 4, 512))
        {
            var inventory = c.getWorld().getInventory(214, 4, 512);

            // Do something with chest's inventory
        }
    }

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Empty the inventory.
      IInventory getMinecraftInventory()
      Get Minecraft inventory instance.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Get basic inventory's name.
      IScriptItemStack getStack(int index)
      Get stack in slot at given index.
      boolean hasCustomName()
      Whether this inventory has a name.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Check whether this inventory is empty.
      IScriptItemStack removeStack(int index)
      Remove a stack at given index // Assuming that c.getSubject() is a player var inventory = c.getSubject().getInventory(); var first = inventory.removeStack(0); if (first.isEmpty()) { c.getSubject().send("Oh... you had nothing..."); } else { c.getSubject().send("Ha-ha, I stole your " + first.getItem().getId()); }
      void setName(java.lang.String name)
      Set basic inventory's name.
      void setStack(int index, IScriptItemStack stack)
      Replace given stack at index.
      int size()
      Return the maximum amount of item stacks in this inventory.

    • Method Detail

      • getMinecraftInventory

        IInventory getMinecraftInventory()
        Get Minecraft inventory instance. BEWARE: you need to know the MCP mappings in order to directly call methods on this instance!

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Check whether this inventory is empty.

      • size

        int size()
        Return the maximum amount of item stacks in this inventory. 
        
    // Assuming that c.getSubject() is a player
    var inventory = c.getSubject().getInventory();
    var item = mappet.createItem("minecraft:stick");

    for (var i = 0; i < inventory.size(); i++)
    {
        // We do a little bit of trolling
        inventory.setStack(i, item);
    }

      • getStack

        IScriptItemStack getStack(int index)
        Get stack in slot at given index. 
        
    // Assuming that c.getSubject() is a player
    var inventory = c.getSubject().getInventory();
    var first = inventory.getStack(0);

    if (first.isEmpty())
    {
        // Give a stick into first player's hotbar slot
        inventory.setStack(0, mappet.createItem("minecraft:stick"));
    }
        Returns:
        an item stack at given index

      • removeStack

        IScriptItemStack removeStack(int index)
        Remove a stack at given index 
        
    // Assuming that c.getSubject() is a player
    var inventory = c.getSubject().getInventory();
    var first = inventory.removeStack(0);

    if (first.isEmpty())
    {
        c.getSubject().send("Oh... you had nothing...");
    }
    else
    {
        c.getSubject().send("Ha-ha, I stole your " + first.getItem().getId());
    }
        Returns:
        removed item stack

      • setStack

        void setStack(int index,
              IScriptItemStack stack)
        Replace given stack at index. 
        
    // Assuming that c.getSubject() is a player
    var inventory = c.getSubject().getInventory();

    inventory.setStack(4, mappet.createItem("minecraft:diamond_sword"));

      • clear

        void clear()
        Empty the inventory. 
        
    // Assuming that c.getSubject() is a player
    c.getSubject().getInventory().clear();

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Get basic inventory's name. This works only for inventories that support naming, like chests.

      • hasCustomName

        boolean hasCustomName()
        Whether this inventory has a name. This works only for inventories that support naming, like chests.

      • setName

        void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Set basic inventory's name. This works only for inventories that support naming, like chests.
